quote: I used to have an open mind, but my brains kept falling out.
source: Bumper Sticker from [*Uncle John's Triumphant 20th Anniversary Bathroom Reader*](https://www.amazon.com/Uncle-Triumphant-Anniversary-Bathroom-Reader/dp/1592230938)

quote: I feel like I'm diagonally parked in a parallel universe.
source: Bumper Sticker from [*Uncle John's Triumphant 20th Anniversary Bathroom Reader*](https://www.amazon.com/Uncle-Triumphant-Anniversary-Bathroom-Reader/dp/1592230938)

quote: The early bird may get the worm, but the second mouse gets the cheese.
source: Bumper Sticker from [*Uncle John's Triumphant 20th Anniversary Bathroom Reader*](https://www.amazon.com/Uncle-Triumphant-Anniversary-Bathroom-Reader/dp/1592230938)

quote: If we quit voting, will they all go away?
source: Bumper Sticker from [*Uncle John's Triumphant 20th Anniversary Bathroom Reader*](https://www.amazon.com/Uncle-Triumphant-Anniversary-Bathroom-Reader/dp/1592230938)

quote: When everything is coming your way, you're in the wrong lane.
source: Bumper Sticker from [*Uncle John's Triumphant 20th Anniversary Bathroom Reader*](https://www.amazon.com/Uncle-Triumphant-Anniversary-Bathroom-Reader/dp/1592230938)

quote: My dog can lick anyone.
source: Bumper Sticker from [*Uncle John's Triumphant 20th Anniversary Bathroom Reader*](https://www.amazon.com/Uncle-Triumphant-Anniversary-Bathroom-Reader/dp/1592230938)

quote: Plan to be spontaneous tomorrow.
source: Bumper Sticker from [*Uncle John's Triumphant 20th Anniversary Bathroom Reader*](https://www.amazon.com/Uncle-Triumphant-Anniversary-Bathroom-Reader/dp/1592230938)

quote: I need somebody bad. Are you bad?
source: Bumper Sticker from [*Uncle John's Triumphant 20th Anniversary Bathroom Reader*](https://www.amazon.com/Uncle-Triumphant-Anniversary-Bathroom-Reader/dp/1592230938)

quote: If you have a difficult task, give it to a lazy person; they will find an easier way to do it.
source: Hlade's Law, sometimes misattributed to Bill Gates

quote: Anything that can go wrong, will—at the worst possible moment.
Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.
No.
The more you weigh, the harder you are to kidnap. Stay safe. Eat cake.
source: Billboards at assorted eateries in NYC

quote: Wake, girl. Your head is becoming the pillow.
You're too late too early.
Age is a very high price to pay for maturity.
Do what you think is right in your heart. You’ll be criticized anyway.
Eat well, stay fit, die anyway.
Experience is a wonderful thing. It enables you to recognize a mistake when you make it again.
Bowling is a sport for those who have talent to spare.
It is better to be thought a fool than to open your mouth and remove all doubt.
It is better to swallow words than to have to eat them later.
I’ve had a perfectly wonderful evening, but this wasn’t it.
I’ve suffered a great many catastrophies in my life. Most of them never happened.
Mistakes will happen; others will be blamed.
Never criticize a man till you have walked a mile in his shoes. That way when you do criticize him, you are a mile ahead and you have his shoes.
Never try to teach a pig to sing. It only frustrates you and really annoys the pig.
Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
Speak the truth but leave immediately after.
There’s nothing wrong with you that reincarnation won’t cure.
When you get at the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on.
Who was the one who put the needle in the haystack anyway?
Sudo make me a sandwich
Is the house made of flesh? Or is he made of house?
If you fall, I'll be there.
You know it's cold outside when you go outside and it's cold.
The difference between genius and stupidity is that genius has its limits.
If you can't convince them, confuse them.
Me? I should get down off this unicorn and slap you.
Life is not a fairy tale. If you lose your shoe at midnight, you're drunk.
The more I learn about other people, the more I like my dog.
When life shuts a door on you, open it again. That's how they work.
Most good programmers do programming not because they expect to get paid or get adulation by the public, but because it is fun to program.
One bad programmer can easily create two new jobs a year.
Computers are good at following instructions, but not at reading your mind.
Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining or testing your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
When debugging, novices insert corrective code; experts remove defective code.

And then it occurred to me that a computer is a stupid machine with the ability to do incredibly smart things, while computer programmers are smart people with the ability to do incredibly stupid things. They are, in short, a perfect match.
Never argue with stupid people— they will drag you down to their level and then beat you with experience.
Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.
Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.
Whether you think you can, or think you can't, you're right.
If at first you don't succeed, then skydiving definitely isn't for you.
There's no way I was born to just pay bills and die.
Everything is figureoutable.
Don't worry about the world coming to an end today. It is already tomorrow in Australia.
A positive attitude may not solve all your problems but it will annoy enough people to make it worth the effort.
Holding onto anger is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die.
Do not judge my story by the chapter you walked in on.
Stop waiting for Prince Charming. Get up and find him. The poor idiot may be stuck in a tree or something.
You can't leave footprints in the sands of time if you're sitting on your butt. And who wants to leave butt prints in the sands of time?
When something goes wrong in your life, just yell, "Plot Twist!" and move on.
Cupcakes are muffins that believed in miracles.
Some people just need a high-five. <small>In the face. <small>With a chair.</small></small>
I'm allergic to stupidity. I break out in sarcasm.
I want to be like water. I want to slip through fingers, but hold up a ship.
I can explain it to you but I can't understand it for you.
Move fast and break things.
source: [*Move Fast and Break Things: How Facebook, Google, and Amazon Cornered Culture and Undermined Democracy*](https://www.amazon.com/Move-Fast-Break-Things-Undermined/dp/0316275778)

quote: A very great deal more truth can be known than can be proven.
The real problem in speech is not *precise* language. The problem is *clear* language.
Science is the belief in the ignorance of experts.
The first principle is that you must not fool yourself— and you are the easiest person to fool.
We are not to tell nature what she's gotta be. … She's always got better imagination than we have.
Nature isn't classical, dammit, and if you want to make a simulation of nature, you'd better make it quantum mechanical, and by golly it's a wonderful problem, because it doesn't look so easy.

There are 10<sup>11</sup> stars in the galaxy. That used to be a *huge* number. But it's only a hundred billion. It's less than the national deficit! We used to call them astronomical numbers. Now we should call them economical numbers.
What I cannot create, I do not understand. Know how to solve every problem that has been solved.
source: Richard Feynman, on his blackboard at the time of his death at Caltech

quote: Einstein was a giant. His head was in the clouds, but his feet were on the ground. But those of us who are not that tall have to choose!
The "paradox" is only a conflict between reality and your feeling of what reality "ought to be."
Nature uses only the longest threads to weave her patterns, so each small piece of her fabric reveals the organization of the entire tapestry.
source: Richard Feynman, *The Character of Physical Law*

quote: I think I can safely say that nobody understands quantum mechanics.
source: Richard Feynman, *The Character of Physical Law*

quote: I don't know what's the matter with people: they don't learn by understanding; they learn by some other way— by rote or something. Their knowledge is so fragile!
source: Richard Feynman, *Surely You're Joking, Mr. Feynman!*

quote: I have the king, because I AM the king!
Calculator lied! The calculator is not God!
Once I went down the road of being a stinker, I couldn't go back.
If at first you don't succeed, hide all evidence you ever tried.
It's not magic sauce.
I dream of a better tomorrow, where chickens can cross the road and not be questioned about their motives.
Those people who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
When tempted to fight fire with fire, remember that the Fire Department usually uses water.
It's true hard work never killed anybody, but I figure, why take the chance?
America is a country where half the money is spent buying food, and the other half is spent trying to lose weight.
If you do a job too well, you'll get stuck with it.
Before I got married I had six theories about bringing up children; now I have six children and no theories.
A filing cabinet is a place where you can lose your things systematically.
Progress isn't made by early risers. It's made by lazy men trying to find easier ways to do something.
Choosing a college is just my wallet fighting my ego.
source: *Someone in a college admitted group chat*

quote: You might ask yourself, 'Self, ...'
Celebration of knowledge
I'd like to invite you to try the following problems for homework.
Caesar divided Gaul into three parts, but we only need two here.
source: Mr. Ecsedy, in a lesson about power series
